data.title: American Cinematheque
data.text:
ABOUT THE FILM:

Writer-director Barbara Loden’s sole feature is a groundbreaking work of American independent cinema, bringing to life a kind of character seldom seen onscreen. Set amid a soot-choked Pennsylvania landscape, and shot in an intensely intimate vérité style, the film takes up with distant and soft-spoken Wanda (Loden), who has left her husband, lost custody of her children and now finds herself alone. A rarely seen masterpiece that has nonetheless exerted an influence on generations of artists and filmmakers, WANDA is a compassionate and wrenching portrait of a woman stranded on society’s margins.

“One of the best American independent films ever made.” – Richard Brody, The New Yorker

FORMAT: DCP

DISTRIBUTOR: Janus Films

COUNTRY: USA
